New Records: David Fry hit the franchise’s first go-ahead, pinch-hit home run to secure the win on the road.
Key Match Events: The Guardians won a back-and-forth affair 5-4 on Thursday to force the fifth and decisive game of the series.
Pre-Game Insights: Rainy weather has prompted MLB to move up Game 5 of the American League Division Series between the Cleveland Guardians and Detroit Tigers.
Instead of starting Saturday at 8:08 p.m. ET, first pitch at Progressive Field in Cleveland will be at 1:08 p.m. ET.
According to the Weather Network, the forecast calls for occasional showers in the afternoon and rain at night in Cleveland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The winner of Saturday’s game will meet the New York Yankees in the American League Championship Series, set to begin Monday night in The Bronx.
